all_summaries: AutoChemSchematic AI is a closed-loop, physics-aware agentic framework for automatically generating chemical process and instrumentation diagrams, integrating domain-specific small language models (SLMs) with physics-aware validation to enable end-to-end automation. The framework employs a multi-stage SLM fine-tuning process, leveraging synthetic datasets and retrieval augmentation from a hierarchical chemical knowledge graph, combined with rigorous simulation-based validation using DWSIM. Results demonstrate that the synergy between fine-tuning and Graph Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) enables high-fidelity PFD/PID generation with strong generalization capabilities, particularly in zero-shot synthesis of novel chemical processes and core engineering QA tasks, including PFD/PID interpretation and analysis. The framework effectively bridges the gap between digital discovery and industrial deployment, addressing key R&D bottlenecks by automating the generation of process flow and instrumentation descriptions for novel chemical processes.

The approach combines multi-stage SLM fine-tuning, retrieval augmentation from a hierarchical chemical knowledge graph, and rigorous simulation-based validation using DWSIM, achieving high-fidelity PFD/PID generation with strong generalization capabilities. The framework excels at core engineering QA tasks, including PFD/PID interpretation and analysis, and effectively bridges the gap between digital discovery and industrial deployment, addressing key R&D bottlenecks.
